decision_conditions: The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue  of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class L  of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as the proposed change of use relies on extensions to the property which are not built or substantially complete.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue  of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as the applicant has failed to demonstrate, given the substantial size of the proposed bedrooms, which could result in double occupancy, that the maximum number of residents would be 6 in total.
description: Erection of single storey side & rear extension, conversion of roof space to habitable use to include a rear dormer with conversion of roof from hip to gable end; and change of use of dwellinghouse (C3 Use Class) to a House in Multiple Occupation (C4 Use Class) consisting of five bedrooms and up to a maximum of 6 residents
